thread.title: Transport minister Jo Johnson resigns, blaming the handling of Brexit

author: Jon Lewis
title: Transport minister Jo Johnson resigns, blaming the handling of Brexit
text:
Transport minister Jo Johnson resigns, blaming the handling of Brexit Transport Minister Mr Johnson backed Remain in the 2016 referendum Share Get Daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Transport minister Jo Johnson has quit the Government amidst a demand for a second Brexit referendum.
Transport Minister Mr Johnson - the brother of Boris Johnson - backed Remain in the 2016 referendum.
But in a resignation video posted on Twitter , he warned Theresa May's withdrawal deal would leave the UK outside the EU but “wholly subject” to its rules.
The Orpington MP, whose brother Boris spearheaded the Leave campaign, said: “I think it is imperative that we now go back to the people and check that they are content to proceed on this extraordinary basis.
“Instead of 'in Europe but not run by Europe', we will be out of Europe and yet wholly subject to European rules.”
Ben Bradshaw talks about Brexit below Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
He was previously a universities minister.
Mr Johnson says the hopes that existed for the "easiest deal in history" have turned out to be "delusions".
He said the UK is on the brink of the "biggest crisis since World War II.
